page.title: 12WANSFORD POST OFFICE
page.content: There has been a shop on this site for many years, but the Post Office was added five years ago. The shop was originally a house on the Great North Road and has been extended backwards into two cottages, one of which contains the Post Office. The shop sells a wide range of goods, including items which might normally be seen in other types of shops. The Post Office also offers different services because it serves a wide area: The postmaster collects council rents, issues car tax, deals with National Savings Bank deposits as well as paying out Department of Health and Social Security benefits. The Post Office also acts as a mail sorting office and three post-men work from this office to deliver letters to the surrounding villages.
